free_text.Learning outcomes: - The students will be able to describe and to analyse the basic characteristics of optical detectors[br/]- The will explain the working principle of the main optical sensors[br/]- They will develop physical models for the different components and they will infer the fundamental equations describing their behavior[br/]- They will analyze the detection principles in order to optimize the single pixel and elaborate cameras adapted to various applications[br/]- They will learn to read and understand the datasheets of commercial optical detectors.
free_text.Content: [b]1. Introduction[/b][br/]Electromagnetic radiation, radiometric quantities, interaction of light with matter, classification of detectors, noise sources, detector figures of merit.[br/][b]2. Opticla methods: few exemples[/b][br/]Synchrone detection and interferometers, position sensors, 3D imaging, Fourier optics and microscopy, spectral measurements.[br/][b]3. Thermal detectors[/b][br/]Basic relationships, bolometers, thermocouples, pyroelectric detectors, applications.[br/][b]4. Photoemissive detectors[/b][br/]External photoeffect, vacuum photodiodes, photomultipliers, microchannels, applications[br/][b]5. Photovoltaic detectors[/b][br/]Photodiodes (p-n diodes, p-i-n diodes, schottky diodes), avalanche photodiodes, noise sources, ultimate limits of photovoltaic photodectection, interface electronics, applications.[br/][b]6. Photoconductive detectors[/b][br/]Photoconductivity, photoconductors, noise sources, applications.[br/][b]7. Line and area image sensors[/b][br/]- Charge Coupled Devices (CCD): CCD principles and building blocks,[br/]- CCD charge transport and image sensor architectures[br/]- CMOS based Image sensors: Photocharge detection, photodiodes in CMOS, traditional MOS photodiodes array sensor architectures, noise in photo detection systems, the APS (Active Pixel Sensor).
